Twister_Alley:
{{Infobox musical artist | | name = Twister Alley | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Arkansas]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1987–1994 | label = [[Mercury Nashville|Mercury]] | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = Shellee Morris, Steve Goins, Amy Hitt, Randy Loyd, Lance Blythe, Kevin King }} '''Twister Alley''' was an American [[country music]] group formed in 1987. The band consisted of Shellee Morris, Amy Hitt, Steve Goins, Lance Blythe, Randy Loyd and Kevin King. They released one album on [[Mercury Nashville]] in 1993. Their highest charting single, "Nothing in Common But Love," peaked at No. 61 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart. ==''Twister Alley'' (1993)== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = ''Twister Alley'' | type = studio | artist = Twister Alley | cover = TwisterAlley.jpg | alt = | released = {{start date|1993|8|17}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | length = 37:52 | label = Mercury | producer = Mike Lawler
